item.description:
Hi all,
Tom cannot attend. Graciously, group member Frank has agreed to host this event in my absence.

The latest by director Patrice Leconte is a low-key comedy starring Daniel Auteuil. Leconte's recent works include The Widow of St. Pierre and The Girl on the Bridge although he is probably more well-known for his films from the 90's: Ridicule, Monsieur Hire, and The Hairdresser's Husband.

The plot is simple: an arrogant antique dealer has a birthday party where it is noticed that everyone who attends are business acquaintences. So, with the wager of a priceless vase on the line, he must produce a true friend within 10 days. With nowhere to turn, he takes the advice of a local cab-driver.

I admit the reviews have been mixed but I think even a minor effort by Leconte will make for an enjoyble summer evening. Here is a link to one review:

http://www.viewlondon...

As a 90 minute feature I think this would make for a relatively painless mid-week event, with the discussion being over by 10 pm or so.

Frank will near the front row at the movies conclusion where the group members will meet and then go to a local restaurant to discuss.

Hope you have fun and be sure to thank Frank for me,
Tom

PS- For some unknown reason, I CANNOT change my RSVP status. Oh well.
item.name: Patrice Leconte's New Movie- My Best Friend
